docs.snippet: Chinese billionaire Pony Ma Huateng, the founder of internet group Tencent, on Friday said his company would donate 2 percent of its annual profit to charity as mobile technology and new philanthropy laws in China make donations easier.

headline.print_headline: Tencent to Donate 2 Percent of Profit as Chinese Online Charity Grows
headline.main: Tencent to Donate 2 Percent of Profit as Chinese Online Charity Grows

docs.snippet: Food lovers and chefs in Italy and beyond are urging restaurants to serve up more pasta all'amatriciana in a move to support the quake-hit hometown of the hearty dish.

headline.print_headline: Comfort Food: Eat All'amatriciana to Help Quake Victims
headline.main: Comfort Food: Eat All'amatriciana to Help Quake Victims

docs.snippet: The polarization between the prosperous urban regions and the rural areas where people feel left behind was sharply clear in Tuesday’s vote.

docs.snippet: Police video shows an officer in Maryland pepper-spraying a 15-year-old girl who refused to cooperate after her bicycle hit a car.

headline.main: Chief: Officers Justified in Pepper-Spraying Maryland Girl

docs.snippet: In the midst of a five-hour standoff that turned deadly, Facebook granted an emergency request from the Baltimore County Police Department to take offline the social media accounts belonging to a woman who wielded a shotgun at officers.

headline.print_headline: Social Media Deactivated During Police Standoff With Woman
headline.main: Social Media Deactivated During Police Standoff With Woman
